Data: Deaths within 28 days of positive test by date of death
Quick description: Daily numbers of people who died within 28 days of being identified as a COVID-19 case by a positive test. Data are shown by date of death.

Data: New deaths within 28 days of a positive test rolling sum by publish date
Quick description: The number of people who died within 28 days of being identified as a COVID-19 case by a positive test in the rolling 7-day period ending on the dates shown. Data are shown by the date the figures appeared in the published totals.

Daily numbers of new cases. Data are shown by the date the sample was taken from the person being tested./NLData for the most recent days are considered incomplete as it takes time for tests to have an outcome and be recorded on relevant lab systems.

Data: New cases by specimen date rolling sum
Quick description: The number of new cases within rolling 7-day periods. Data are shown by the date the sample was taken from the person being tested./NLData for the most recent days are considered incomplete as it takes time for tests to have an outcome and be recorded on relevant lab systems.

Data: Cumulative deaths within 28 days of a positive test by death date
Quick description: Total number people who died within 28 days of being identified as a COVID-19 case by a positive test since the start of the pandemic. Data are shown by date of death.

Total number of cases since the start of the pandemic. Data are shown by the date the sample was taken from the person being tested./NLData for the most recent days are considered incomplete as it takes time for tests to have an outcome and be recorded on relevant lab systems.

Data: New daily national statistics office deaths by death date
Quick description: Daily numbers of deaths of people whose death certificate mentioned COVID-19 as one of the causes. Data are reported by date of death. There is a lag in reporting of at least 11 days because the data are based on death registrations.
